adjective.description: Refraining from speech or temporarily speechless.
examples: Irene, the talkative one, was now mute

adjective.description: (of a person) lacking the faculty of speech.

examples: mute e is generally dropped before suffixes beginning with a vowel

noun.description: A person lacking the faculty of speech.
A clamp placed over the bridge of a stringed instrument to deaden the resonance without affecting the vibration of the strings.
A device on a television, telephone, or other appliance that temporarily turns off the sound.
examples: she put the remote on mute

verb.description: Deaden, muffle, or soften the sound of.
examples: her footsteps were muted by the thick carpet

origin: Late Middle English: from Anglo-Norman mut, mute, moute pack of hounds trained for hunting, from Latin movere to move.
